column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////I'm not giving this place 5 stars (as much deserved for their food) because of my last experience there. My husband & I came in on a not so busy Sunday morning. I requested for a booth instead of the community table. The hostess
column3: told us there's no more booths. As she sat us down on the community table
column4: dead in front of us was an open booth. Minutes later that same hostess seated 2 white ladies at that booth. I didn't say anything because I didn't want to make a scene. We just sat there & ate our food
column5: feeling upset & pondering...why are we being treated this way? Essentially we're all paying customers
column6: no matter what ethnicity. Just ignorance.
